text: Capo Vaticano Lighthouse () is an active lighthouse located in Capo Vaticano, which is a Cape in the south western Calabria on the Tyrrhenian Sea. ==Description== The lighthouse was built in 1885 and consists of a white cylindrical tower, high, with balcony and lantern attached to the front 1-storey white keeper's house. The lantern, painted in metallic grey, is positioned at above sea level and emits four white flashes in a 20 seconds period, visible at of distance. The lighthouse is fully automated and is operated by the Marina Militare and is identified by the code number 2708 E.F. ==See also== * List of lighthouses in Italy * Capo Vaticano ==References== ==External links== * Servizio Fari Marina Militare Category:Lighthouses in Italy
title: Capo Vaticano Lighthouse
